benchmark_details.name: Footstep-set and Impact-set
benchmark_details.overview: Two sound effect datasets designed to evaluate both controllability and sound quality in sound synthesis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark a similarity-based conditioning method for controllable sound effect synthesis.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The effective range of control is densely concentrated around similarity scores of 0.8 to 1.0.

data.source: Collected from Freesound, categorized into detailed sound effect categories.
data.annotation: Categorized based on the material of the contacting surface.

methodology.calculation: FAD measures the overall similarity between two distributions: the reference dataset and the reconstructed dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Lower FAD values indicate better synthesis quality.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using objective metrics (FAD, LSD) against existing models.
